title: Forces - Sum of forces for constant velocity

content.description: Three forces are exerted on an object, as shown in the figure.
content.question: Which of the following best represents the net force exerted on the object?

choices.label: The figure shows a dot at the intersection of a horizontal dashed line and a vertical dashed line. An arrow labeled 11 newtons extends upward and to the left from the dot at an angle of 37 degrees from the horizontal.

The figure shows a dot at the intersection of a horizontal dashed line and a vertical dashed line. An arrow labeled 7 newtons extends downward and to the right from the dot at an angle of 30 degrees from the horizontal.

The figure shows a dot at the intersection of a horizontal dashed line and a vertical dashed line. An arrow labeled 7 newtons extends upward and to the left from the dot at an angle of 30 degrees from the vertical.

The figure shows a dot at the intersection of a horizontal dashed line and a vertical dashed line. An arrow labeled 5 newtons extends upwards and to the left from the dot at an angle of 37 degrees from the horizontal.

content.answer: The figure shows a dot at the intersection of a horizontal dashed line and a vertical dashed line. An arrow labeled 5 newtons extends upwards and to the left from the dot at an angle of 37 degrees from the horizontal.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
